its current workers are located. In a speech Tuesday, Eric Schmidt said Google Inc. will hire more than 1,000 workers in Europe this year. All told, Google Inc. has more than 60 offices in 30 countries. At this stage, the number of opportunities just vastly exceed the number of people we have at the company, said Alan Eustace , Google Inc. 's senior vice president of engineering and research. Even if it surpasses 31,000 employees this year, Google Inc. will still have far fewer people than Microsoft Corp., among its fiercest rival.

' A promise kept' ''Some in the cynical political class are saying this is a gimmick, an empty gesture,'' said Indiana Rep. Mike Pence , a possible Republican presidential candidate. We on the other side call it a promise kept. That refrain was repeated by Republicans often during the House debate. One reservation about a presidential bid that Mr. Mike Pence has expressed in private meetings is whether he can raise the money to compete with the well-funded Mitt Romney . But Mr. Benko said that shouldn't be a hindrance. If Mike Pence runs, the money will follow in a big way, he said.
